Title: Marketing Coordinator - Brampton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for the coordination and administration of marketing and industry promotional activities for MULTIVAC Canada (MUCA). This position will work closely with the Market Development Manager (MDM) and will display creativity alongside excellent communication and time management skills.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Includes the following however, other related duties may be assigned, if required.
Manage all aspects of marketing for MUCA.
Create, publish, and maintain the Marketing Plan.
Coordinate trade show attendance, lead generation, and ensure regular publicity within trade press. Provide a trade show report (results analysis) following the event.
Organise MUCA “open days”.
Provide administration support for all exhibitions and events.
Manage all aspects of public relations.
Liaise with MULTIVAC Germany (MUWO) as required on all areas of marketing activity.
Ensure branding and image is maintained. Internally and externally, enhance the MULTIVAC image and reputation.
Promote MULTIVAC’s range of capital equipment and consumables, including third party products.
Represent MULTIVAC at all levels within existing customer base.
Assist in the preparation and subsequent achievement of the marketing and annual sales budgets.
Support MUCA’s sales growth targets and share of the market according to business plan. Support sales functions to continually increase opportunity pipeline.
Attendance at exhibitions and events within Canada and out-of-country may be necessary, along with occasional work outside of regular business hours.
Liaise with service providers such as printing providers, design suppliers, and daughter companies to ensure we are on top of all potential marketing strategies. Ensure activities are aligned with MUCA’s marketing budget.
Working with the Regional Sales Managers (RSMs), ensure at least six success stories are published internally or externally annually.
Maintain an in-depth knowledge and awareness of competitor activities in the marketplace, such as trade magazine ad spotting, and report back new intelligence information to the MDM and Vice-President of Sales & Marketing (VP).
Display initiative by proactively developing and maintaining a competent awareness of packaging, processing, inspection equipment and bakery products.
Able to manage own diary and workload as required.
Assist the MDM when required.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities
Work closely with media to manage the delivery of advertising and PR to meet the annual media schedule, ensuring artwork is received accurately and to required deadlines.
Maintain the Shared drive and Teams folder with up to date literature, videos and information.
Stock control of brochures and gifts.
Social media management, ensuring updates are communicated across the business.
Attend sales meetings as required.
Handle email traffic (@info) promptly to the mutual satisfaction of customers and MUCA.
Liaise with internal colleagues across multiple departments (Service, Sales, senior leadership team (SLT)) to develop sales, support processes, and attend training.
Visit customer sites with other MUCA employees when appropriate; make presentations to individuals or group at all levels.
Prepare presentations, technical literature to support proposals, and produce additional sales & marketing materials as requested.
Maintain a diary of day-to-day activities on the Outlook calendar.
Undertake any other duties as reasonably requested by the MDM, VP, and SLT.
Qualifications
Two to four years College or University marketing or communications degree program.
B2B marketing experience is required.
Previous experience in content management, creative writing, advertising concepts, marketing automation platforms (e.g. email marketing) and media negotiations is required.
Experience within and working knowledge of the food manufacturing sector (especially meat) and related industries is an asset. Experience within industrial, pharmaceutical and healthcare is also considered relevant.
An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of MS Office programs, Internet software, ERP systems, Photoshop, and spreadsheet software.
Digital marketing system as a specialization or at least good working knowledge.
Expert knowledge of CRM systems is required (C4C preferable).
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $60,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
Additional pay:
Bonus pay
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
RRSP match
Vision care
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
B2B marketing: 1 year (required)
CRM software: 3 years (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Marketing Data Analyst - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Name: Corby Spirit and Wine Limited
Location: Toronto, ON
Corby’s portfolio
of owned-brands includes some of the most renowned brands in Canada, including Wiser's Canadian Whisky, Lamb's Rum and Polar Ice Vodka. Through its affiliation with Pernod Ricard S.A., Corby also represents leading international brands such as ABSOLUT Vodka, Chivas Regal, Glenlivet, Ballantine’s Scotch Whiskies, Jameson Irish Whiskey, Beefeater Gin, Malibu Rum, Kahlua Liqueur, Mumm Champagne, Jacob's Creek, Wyndham Estate and Stoneleigh wines. An overview of the entire Corby portfolio shows over 5,000,000 cases sold annually, with Corby being a significant importer of wines and having an approximate 21 percent market share of spirit sales in Canada.
Why work at Corby? Because we are a great place to work! And we’re not the only ones who think so. Corby was named one of Canada’s Best Workplaces for 7 years by The Great Place to Work® Institute Canada, based on employee survey results and an audit of workplace excellence and people management practices.
Note: All candidates must be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and present proof upon hiring unless you qualify for a reasonable accommodation based on a human rights protected ground (effective November 15, 2021).
Position Summary
Note: this position is designated as a 12-month contract.
We are seeking a passionate and independent individual to support a new era of performance measurement and investment strategy at Corby Spirit and Wine Limited. This individual will be responsible for supporting a high priority global and local initiative, the implementation of a new Mix Marketing Modelling Tool (MMM), touching traditional and digital media, A&P investment strategy(ies), and global marketing performance. The successful candidate will need to be a solid communicator, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and passionate about analytics and data modelling. Supporting this individual will be a network of other teams and agencies both internally and externally throughout the duration of the project.
The role reports to the Director of Data and Digital Transformation and will be a key role in ensuring the readiness and accuracy of the Model to deliver actionable insights transformed into business decisions. The successful candidate will be an intellectually curious builder who is biased toward action and collaboration.
Based in Toronto, you will assist in the quest to drive the Data and Digital foundation at Corby Spirit and Wine Limited, by supporting implementation of our new Mix Modelling Marketing Tool.
Key Responsibilities
Partner with our Global deployment teams to filter and “clean” data from different sources (Marketing team, Trade Marketing Teams, Media Partners…)
Track missing or incomplete data and follow-up to resolve issues
Prepare data, including complete and timely entry of these activities
Collaborate with colleagues to ensure accurate and valid data flows through systems
Identify key issues and root causes to resolve issues and improve data quality
Review computer reports, printouts to locate and correct Models / Algorithm
Work hand-in-hand with the Data & Digital Transformation team to define new processes and capabilities for the business
Other duties as required
Required Skills & Abilities
Analytical and strategic in thought; self-motivated with the ability to take the initiative
Organized, attention to detail, and technical intuition
Ability to understand business needs
Pragmatic and capable of solving complex issues
Strong communication and relationship building skills
Service oriented, agile, and a team player
Curious and eager to learn and to upskill
Must be fluent in English, Bilingual an asset (FR)
Understanding of provincial liquor and promotional laws an asset
Education & Experience (Required and Preferred)
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Marketing, Business, Statistics, or related field preferred
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attend to presentation, detail, and accuracy
2-3 Years of web/marketing analytics experience with a focus on data extraction and reporting
Strong expertise in data and media campaign analytics
Good understanding of paid media digital tactics, platforms and data sources
Proven experience in building reporting database, and turning insights into action
Intermediate knowledge of MS Office product suite with Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and be able to develop Excel macros
Knowledge of any data viz tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik)
Experience with collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, Google Analytics) would be a plus
Preferred: Experience in CPG or/and experience in a media agency
We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.
Corby Spirit and Wine Ltd is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Should you require accommodation during any phase of the recruitment process or wish to view our accommodation policies, please contact the Human Resources Department at
Accessibilty.Canada@pernod-ricard.com
Thank you for your interest in Pernod Ricard and its subsidiaries, Corby Spirit and Wine Limited and Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd. All resumes submitted will be reviewed
by our recruitment
team and kept on file for six months in consideration for this and future opportunities. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Please do not contact provincial offices directly as all recruitment is coordinated through the Corporate Office in Toronto.

Target Hire Date:
2022-01-03-08
:00

Title: Digital Marketing Automation Specialist - Delta, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Position:
Digital Marketing Automation Specialist
Location:
Vaudreuil-Dorion, Quebec (primary), but open to other locations (Ontario, Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver)
Status:
Permanent, full-time (1)
Company Profile
Quadra Chemicals is one of North America's leading distributors of chemicals and ingredients. We have facilities across Canada and are expanding quickly in the United States. We are a fast-growing company with a long-term commitment to our employees. If you are committed to excellence and driven by results, you belong at Quadra! Our employees are professional and passionate about our business.
Founded over 45 years ago, Quadra is dedicated to its 450+ employees located in Canada and the United States. At Quadra, we offer not only a committed culture, a collaborative environment based on family spirit and mutual support, but also a lot of autonomy and flexibility. We also offer you the opportunity to be part of a professional, fun, innovative and committed team in a growing, people-oriented, Great Place to Work certified organization. In addition to being Great Place to Work certified, Quadra is recognized as one of the "Best Managed Companies," "Great Place to Work for Women," and "Great Place to Work for Mental Wellness." You will work with dynamic colleagues who are eager to share their knowledge with you.
Role
We are currently seeking a professional to fill the position of Digital Marketing Automation Specialist to join our Marketing team. As a Digital Marketing Automation Specialist, you will be responsible for administering the marketing automation platform and fully leveraging its capabilities to drive business objectives. Working closely with content creators, designers, developers, and the extended marketing team this role will implement all programmatic and operational initiatives through the marketing automation platform.
If you enjoy problem solving and analytical situations, stepping up to new challenges in a fast-paced work environment and the ability to make your mark, then you should consider joining us.
Responsibilities
Responsible for the Pardot instance, manage the backlog and development sprints to support enhancements, system upgrades and integrations
Maintain Marketing Automation integration with CRM and assist in the integration of additional platforms into the marketing automation software
Create, test and deploy single and multi-step e-mail campaigns, landing pages, events and webinars for different distribution channels and segments, utilizing dynamic content
Work closely with business leads and marketing team to manage workload and complete campaign work in a timely and error-free manner
Perform audience segmentation and list processing for campaign deployment
Develop and maintain responsive e-mail templates, troubleshoot issues, and stay abreast of all technology advances
Perform platform-based coding action and tech support
Work with the Marketing and Communication Team to define KPIs, create reports and analyze campaign performance
Manage marketing automation efforts and processes, proactively researching and implementing the latest best practices, strategies, and industry standards
Support essential marketing operations initiatives in Salesforce such as managing the lead lifecycle, lead scoring, lead nurturing, segmentation, and data cleansing
Understand and evaluate campaign metrics and distribute campaign performance to the marketing team
Plan and perform A/B testing to define and execute enhancements to productivity, conversion rates, programs/campaign ROI and sales growth
Responsible for integration of Pardot with Web site to drive business objectives, lead generation, scoring and nurturing
Responsible for the integration of social media platforms with Pardot
Develop standardized processes and programs that allow marketing team members to self-serve in the creation of complex, multi-stage automated marketing programs
Act as an ambassador for Pardot internally and externally and as the primary contact for queries related to the platform
Position Requirements
Bachelor's degree or above preferably in Computer Science, E-commerce, Marketing, Digital Media or related field
2+ years of experience in Marketing Platforms, e.g. Salesforce Pardot (Preferred), Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Oracle Responsys, Oracle Eloqua, Adobe Campaign, Marketo, etc.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Salesforce Pardot. Pardot Certified / Salesforce Admin will be preferred
Understanding of general CRM practice, preferably client-facing experience
In-depth understanding between the relationship of leads, contacts, accounts, campaigns, activities and opportunity objects
Experience working on an agile team using sprints, backlog, and retrospective
Attention to details and excellent decision-making skills
Advanced Excel capability, to include Pivot tables and Scripting
Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail
Preferred experience in digital marketing strategies, best practices, and deliverability
In Salesforce, write queries to extract data needed for client requests, create queries to validate campaign audiences, and construct queries joining multiple tables
Experience with SQL
Preferred Frontend IT skills - be able to use/understand HTML/CSS/Javascript in emails/landing pages.
Preferred Backend IT skills - be able to understand platform backstage logic
Possess a fundamental understanding of end-to-end customer experience integration and dependencies.
Work Conditions
Flexibility and availability may be required to meet project deadlines
Physically able to participate in training sessions, presentations, and meetings including travel
Some travel may be required for the purpose of meeting with partners, stakeholders, or off-site personnel/management
Quadra supports and values diversity and offer equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status and gender identity. Quadra also welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process

Title: Digital Business Analyst - Laval, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Laura Canada is an iconic and innovative family-owned retailer housing two leading women’s fashion apparel brands, Laura and Melanie Lyne. Based in Laval, Quebec, we design, produce, market and distribute quality apparel across Canada. We proudly employ over 2,000 dedicated team members and operate more than 140 locations and two online stores. We attribute our success to the unwavering commitment of our team to delivering outstanding customer experiences while embodying our shared values of integrity, respect, teamwork, performance, and passion.
At Laura Canada, we believe that delivering an outstanding customer experience is driven by our commitment to an outstanding employee experience.
Job Description
The Digital Business Technology Analyst is the key liaison between the Information Technology Department and the Digital Marketing team. They are charged with the implementation and ongoing development of business applications and systems in e-commerce, CRM and digital environments as well as improving business processes.
THE ROLE
1. Analysis, Testing and Implementation
Provides expert business technology guidance to end users.
Manages digital business technology projects, monitors applications and provides analytical solutions to resolve technical issues.
Researches for any process improvements, develops and manages initiatives to improve processes.
Creates and maintains specifications, documents, test plans and scripts for all projects in the assigned domain.
Communicates with business users in order to interpret requirements for IT groups.
Architects, develops, validates and maintains applications.
Performs the review of business requirements and workflow as it relates to implemented solutions.
Acts as a project manager for business technology lead projects.
Prepares test cases, business use cases and participates in the testing process to evaluate the technology solutions.
Supervises changes and improvements implemented on business technology applications.
Resolves defects discovered during all phases of development and maintenance including severity 1 production issues.
Prepares the user training material for the new applications and trains the teams on how to use the various system components and reports.
Prepares and presents reports to Managers, updates training material and guides when required.
2. Daily Management
Provides ongoing and remedial training to the users on how to use the various system components and reports.
Updates users timely and regularly on status of issues and on any business requests.
Coordinates with IT community to develop functional requirements, technical specifications and high-level designs.
Works closely with Developers on data, workflow and additional developmental programming needs.
Provides levels 2 and 3 application support.
THE REQUIREMENTS
7+ years IT experience
Related industry experience is required.
Demonstrated ability to manage projects and strong ability to influence others
Knowledge of SalesForce (SFCC, SFMC, SFSC) systems is required.
Knowledge of Aptos and Momentis systems is an asset.
Detail oriented and able to create business requirement documentation
Ability to work in a team environment as well as at an individual level
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written and presentation)
Ability to prioritize and work with deadlines
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and Outlook)
Working knowledge of the standard Systems Development Life Cycle
Use of query language tools, Microsoft Reporting and/or a background in programming is an asset.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical abilities
Ability to work without supervision
Innovator with quick absorption of new technologies; strong understanding of technology solutions
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work as a member of cross functional teams
Bilingualism
Additional Information
Working Conditions and Environment
This is a full-time position.
Works in a sitting position.

Title: Head of Marketing - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Responsibilities
Partner with the Business Development, Brand and Communications, and Product Management teams to build and scale the Marketing function to drive revenue and grow product awareness.
Design, plan and execute innovative marketing campaigns in line with company objectives.
Measure, evaluate, and iterate campaigns based on their performance.
Manage SEM, SEO and Paid Social; including budgeting, reporting, and hands-on platform management.
Set strategy for our paid marketing initiatives to achieve our revenue and traction goals.
Working closely with the Head of Brand and Communications, develop, execute, and measure Novisto's content strategy to target, convert, and engage ESG practitioners across all channels, including website, social media, email, etc;
Forecast, analyze, measure, and report on the impact of growth marketing activities on sales and other conversion metrics.
Requirements
8+ years experience in digital marketing, product marketing, or growth marketing roles
Demonstrated experience growing revenue via performance marketing within a fast-growing B2B technology company
Extensive experience with digital marketing including performance marketing strategy, digital design, campaigns and reporting
Comfortable rolling up your sleeves and completing the work as you will be building the team from the ground up
Excellent interpersonal skills, and proven ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization
Highly driven, organized self-starter with the ability to independently identify problems and implement solutions
Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to work through data to find opportunities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (bilingualism in French and English is a strong asset)
Experience with ESG reporting or sustainability (an asset)
Desire to join a startup, take ownership, grow a team, and have an impact
What we offer
The opportunity to join an early stage, well-financed company;
The chance to have an impact by creating a product that is bringing positive change around the world;
Generous health benefits;
Beautiful office, in the heart of Old Montreal 2 mins away from the metro.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We are currently looking for a strong full-time Content Marketing Specialist to be a key member of our growing team. The Content Marketing Specialist will collaborate with various resources within the team to deliver the best-of-breed marketing strategies which fuel our future growth. If you have excellent communication skills, a passion for writing, creative graphic design skills, have some experience with social media advertising and a drive to succeed, you are the perfect candidate that we are looking for.
Required Experience:
Bachelor Degree or equivalent qualification
3-5 years writing experience in technical digital marketing with a focus on B2B
Required Skills:
Creative and experienced marketing writer with strong editorial skills who loves to read, research and write
Embrace and understand creating content for social media
Highly organized and goal-oriented and business minded
Ability to layout and design visual content
Fluent with Adobe suite of products - Acrobat, Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop
Excellent command of MS Office applications
Must know HTML/CSS and be comfortable working within a CMS, familiarity with JavaScript and other web programming languages is an asset
Familiarity with technical SEO
Extreme attention to details with respect to writing accuracy, grammatical correctness, etc.
Strong work ethic, a positive 'get it done' attitude and exceptional interpersonal skills
Exemplary organization and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
What do you actually do in this role?
Research industry trends and create engaging technical content to drive demand and inbound traffic
Create visuals and designs for advertising, campaigns, and promotions that help increase readability, searchability and understanding
Track and measure the effectiveness of new and existing content
Create an editorial calendar to manage content distribution and align with the various stages of the customer journey
Manage existing content assets to ensure all content is current, relevant and up-to-date
Collaborate with various members of the team to contribute to the development of sales tools including case studies, presentations, blogs and press releases
Research, write, and edit external-facing platforms including blogs and social media
Manage, monitor and build social media channels including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and other online forums, community websites
Who is KingswaySoft?
KingswaySoft is a leading integration solution provider offering software solutions that make data integration affordable and painlessly easy. We work with thousands of enterprise clients from over 100 countries including many Fortune 500 companies who rely on our solutions to integrate data with various application systems in order to drive their business efficiency and fully leverage their information assets. Client satisfaction and success is our number one priority which we deliver through unparalleled software and superior customer support.
KingswaySoft is a well-established organization with tremendous growth since the inception of the business. We start with the simple mission that is to help make data integration easy for our clients and partners, and we have established ourselves as a leading solution provider in the data integration and migration space.
Why join KingswaySoft?
You want to make an impact
- We create the most sophisticated integration software in the industry, our software is used by thousands of enterprise clients in over 100 countries. At KingswaySoft, you have the opportunity to make a big impact if you excel in writing good software.
You want to be continually challenged
- We emphasize continual improvement within our organization. We always strive to create the highest quality software.
You want to work with an exceptional team
- Our team delivers; we pride ourselves in creating some most creative solutions in the market.
You want an exciting career
- You like a career that is creative, requires innovation to succeed, and is financially and personally rewarding.
You like challenges
- At KingswaySoft, you get the opportunities to create solutions that solve some of the most complicated integration scenarios, you will always find challenges in your development work.
If interested, please send cover letter and resume to [email protected].

Title: Digital Fundraising Manager - Toronto / Montreal - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Veuillez postuler sur Isarta.com :
https://emplois.isarta.com/cgi-bin/emplois/pm.cgi?utm_source=IND&action=display&login=69984
JOB INFORMATION
Position Level:
People Leader
Department:
Fundraising Department/ Digital Unit
Position Status:
Permanent
Activity Rate:
100% (Full time)
Location:
Toronto or Montreal
Salary Grade:
Level D on the MSF Canada Salary Grid, $79,057 per year (non-negotiable)
Status:
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada (
MSF Canada will assist a successful candidate in acquiring such status, including supporting a spouse/common law partner and/or child (unmarried and under 22) for dependent visa status. While MSF Canada will work within its means to secure immigration status for a selected candidate, the success of an immigration application depends on many factors based on the Government of Canada’s rules and regulations. Neither the timing of an application, nor the ultimate outcome, can be guaranteed by MSF Canada or its outside immigration counsel.)
Benefits:
Health Spending Account, Lifestyle Spending Account, group insurance (Life, Dependent Life, AD&D), Peace of Mind plan (i.e. prescription drugs, accidental dental, hospital care, etc.), 5% RRSP contributions (no matching required), starting 4 weeks’ Vacation/year, flexible work hours, annual professional development budget, Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP), free access to internal Psychosocial Care Unit Services and a positive and innovative office culture grounded in our core values of humanity, integrity and results. MSF Canada offers relocation packages covering costs for temporary accommodation, food allowance, travel costs and movement of household goods up to one month’s salary depending on where the candidate is relocating from.
IMPACT STATEMENT
The Digital Fundraising Manager is responsible for supporting direct response digital fundraising activities designed to acquire, convert, reactivate, and welcome new monthly and one-time donors as well as retain, engage, and steward existing monthly and one-time donors. This role is also responsible for managing relationships with a number of digital vendors who help plan and execute various fundraising campaigns. The Digital Fundraising Manager will collaborate with MSF Canada’s Communications Department and will work closely with the Senior Manager for Direct Marketing and Donor Engagement, Senior Manager of Philanthropy, and Loyalty Manager to execute the digital acquisition annual plan, the digital loyalty annual plan, and support strategic fundraising plan goals. They will also directly manage the Digital Fundraising Officer(s) and Digital Fundraising Coordinator to help execute these goals.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Working with the Mass Marketing and Philanthropy teams, support the development and execution of digital fundraising campaigns aimed at both acquisition of new one-time and monthly donors as well as maintaining the annual fund of regular and one-time donors.
Manage digital fundraising suppliers/vendors and staff members (Digital Fundraising Officer(s) and Digital Fundraising Coordinator) to lead digital campaigns including email, digital advertising, and social media as required.
Propose and develop adjustments to the digital acquisition strategy to achieve fundraising goals, and actively participate in identifying campaign themes to support acquisition campaign content.
In collaboration with the Loyalty unit, support email campaigns including strategy, creative content, and project management.
In collaboration with the Loyalty unit, support MSF’s symbolic giving catalogue by providing strategic and creative guidance, project management, and working with digital vendors and staff.
Stay abreast of MSF Canada’s brand guidelines and ensure digital fundraising activities adhere to these standards.
Support other fundraising units with their digital projects and campaigns were required.
Support the communications team with other digital projects as required.
Please
CLICK HERE
for complete description.
JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES
Digital fundraising strategy, execution, and analysis;
Advanced skills in digital social engagement, online campaign development and implementation, online collaboration, digital acquisition campaigns, and knowledge of the donor journey, website strategy development and social media engagement tools and channels.
Digital Vendor Management;
Strong project management skills, with the ability to turn complex projects into clear and manageable workplans, timelines, and deliverables; and analytics skills, with the ability to oversee technical contracts and content production for web and social media
People Management and Leadership;
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, working with multiple stakeholders
CORE COMPETENCIES
Commitment to MSF’s Principles;
The commitment to provide medical assistance to populations in distress, observing the principles of humanitarian action and medical ethics, and the willingness to direct their interest and behaviours towards the social mission of MSF.
Proficiency Level 2:
Demonstrates loyalty, awareness and respect for MSF’s values
Teamwork and Cooperation;
Implies collaboration, sharing and cooperating with others, to work together towards a common goal.
Proficiency Level 3:
Encourages, engages, and motivates people to work as a team
Planning and organizing;
The ability to prioritise and set lines of action, optimising resources (material, human, financial, temporal, etc.), ensuring that anticipated results are obtained by means of efficient management of their own and colleagues’ work and that assigned responsibilities and functions are always clear.
Proficiency level 2:
Enables others to organize.
Results and Quality Orientation;
The drive and tenacity to achieve the defined objectives and to implement efficient solutions within a set timeframe, with the given resources and in accordance with the established procedures and models; the will to constantly seek improvement in the performance of his/her own tasks and actions.
Proficiency Level 2:
Works towards objectives, preserving established standards.
Cross-cultural Awareness;
The capacity to acknowledge, respect and integrate cultural differences in a way that facilitates the achievement of MSF’s objectives.
Proficiency Level 3:
Demonstrates an integrating attitude.
KNOWLEDGE
AND EXPERIENCE
Professional experience in the areas of digital fundraising, digital marketing, or digital communications.
3-5 years’ experience in people management roles with cross functional teams, and demonstrated ability to develop team members and manage large, complex budgets.
Excellent communications and presentation skills with attention to detail
EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS, AND LANGUAGES
Education or training in digital fundraising, digital marketing, digital communications, or a related field
Proficient in English, with strong copy-editing skills
Proficiency in French an asset
Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office applications
APPLICATION
Interested candidates are invited to apply by providing their resume and responding to the questions below (in lieu of providing a cover letter).

Title: SEO and Website Specialist - Saskatoon, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
We’re seeking an optimization enthusiast with a strong digital marketing background who is well versed in SEO and UX/UI to drive growth. The role of the SEO and Website Specialist is to generate leads through organic search. This candidate should possess a deep understanding of digital marketing, particularly as it relates to search engine optimization, lead generation, and analytics. This is a great opportunity to own our search strategy and grow our site into an industry-leading resource.
This role is open to remote candidates.
Responsibilities
Create, develop, and execute measurable and actionable optimization tests designed to increase click-to-conversion rates, reduce CPL, and cost of acquisition
Perform site audits and gather applicable data to recommend site enhancements and campaign optimizations
Work with the SEO manager to research content silos and product pages of SEO optimized content for the corporate marketing website
Develop SEO optimized content for the website for the content silos and pages
Coordinate with the website designers and developers to build and launch content
Build out measurements so the product teams can see how their content is performing
Implement both on-page and off-page SEO tactics to hit our aggressive search goals month over month
Be accountable for website metrics and presenting to demand generation leadership
Conduct keyword research to aid with lead generation, product marketing, product development, and other key initiatives
Own the conversion optimization tactics of our website, including building simple and complex tests within an A/B testing tool and provide analysis on the results
A/B tests, pop-ups, banners and more to improve conversion rates and user experience
Manage link building campaigns and collaborate with corporate marketing on earned media outreach
Optimize landing pages, calls-to-action (CTAs), and lead-generating forms
Skills & Qualifications
5+ years of digital marketing experience
3+ years of experience in key areas of SEO, including link building, keyword research, on-page optimization, off-page optimization, and site audits.
Strong knowledge of content marketing and inbound marketing best practices
Demonstrated experience with test design and experiment planning
Proficiency with analytics tools and web traffic reporting, able to conduct deep data analysis
Knowledge of conversion rate optimization best practices
Data driven; must love statistics and be able to derive meaning from large amounts of data
Strong understanding of connection between advertising, landing pages, and conversion rate optimization
Always seeking out and learning about new strategies, advertising channels, conversion optimization techniques, and experimentation best practices
Able to summarize findings and provide explanations and presentations

Title: Content Marketing Associate (Hybrid) - Brampton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Content Marketing Associate (Hybrid)
*Temporarily remote due to COVID-19 regulations*
As the Content Marketing Associate, you will be responsible for supporting the sales of Canon’s printer and camera products by developing content for its marketing and advertising programs. You will use your knowledge in marketing to develop creative concepts and ideas that support our strategy.
We are excited to offer a new and adaptive way of working that provides flexibility in the workforce while maintaining operational readiness! By blending remote and in-office work, we are able to take advantage of the independence and flexibility that comes with working from home, and the collaboration, teamwork and sense of belonging that comes from working together face-to-face. Our Workstyle Program offers the best of both situations: structure and sociability with independence and flexibility.
What You'll Be Doing
Develop email and webpage content such as articles, copywriting, videos and graphics
Develop and evaluate the production of content by agencies within specified timelines and project deadlines
Identify potential content contributors and content production partners while creating and maintaining positive working relationships
Create and monitor the work back schedules for Canon’s advertising and marketing campaigns
Report on a monthly basis the performance of Canon’s marketing and advertising programs, while maintaining organized records of metrics and results of past campaigns
Source and negotiate contract terms with vendors while maintaining project budgets
Ensure a high organic ranking on search by using keywords throughout all published content·
What We’re Looking For
College diploma in Journalism, Marketing, or Copywriting. Bachelor’s Degree is preferred
3-5 years of work experience
Strong time management skills to work with agencies to develop critical paths with project work-backs
Process management skills for using project-tracking tools and seek completion dates of projects
Excellent technical skills to design programs, use web management tools, perform search engine optimization
Intermediate analytical skills for assessing reports in order to determine digital performance
Experience with WordPress, HTML and a CMS system is considered an asset
French is considered an asset
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
COVID-19 SAFETY PRECAUTIONS
By monitoring public health conditions and following local COVID-19 guidelines, we are taking necessary precautions and putting the safety of our employees and candidates first
REMOTE WORK
This position offers a Hybrid work schedule. You will be required to be in the office Mondays and Wednesdays each week, with the ability to work from home for the remainder of the week (subject to specific business needs requiring office attendance)
When working from home, a reliable internet connection is required. Remote work is supported with cloud-based applications and collaboration tools
BENEFITS
Comprehensive health coverage plan that includes medical, dental and vision
Life insurance, disability and wellness programs
Vacation, Paid Personal Time and Sick days
Matching RRSP contribution & Profit Sharing Program
Tuition Assistance Program for professional continuing education
Discounts on Canon products, retailers, memberships and more!
EMPLOYEE PERKS
On-site cafeteria and outdoor patio
Employee gym and fitness centre
Employee referral program
Inspire Program, online peer-to-peer recognition for redeemable points on hundreds of products.
Community involvement
Canon is committed to the health and safety of our employees, customers and communities. A critical component of our workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy.
Employees are required to be fully vaccinated and must provide Canon with proof of vaccination or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace. Canon will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.
Come and join our team and reap the rewards as we work to take Canon to the next level!
We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, exceptional growth potential and stability, all within a casual and professional work environment.
While we appreciate all applicant submissions, only those considered to be most qualified will be contacted for further assessment.
Canon Canada Inc. is proud to provide accommodation(s) during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodations, please indicate this on your application/cover letter and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us via email at accessibility@canada.canon.com or via phone at
1-855-531-3850
or 905-863-8713
Since 1973, Canon Canada has been the leading provider of consumer, business, professional and medical digital imaging innovation. Technology continuously changes, but our vision and commitment to delivering exceptional solutions and great customer experiences never does.
Headquartered in Brampton, Ontario, with 12 additional offices across the country, Canon is the preferred choice for technology and services that enhance the lives of people and drive business performance. We are committed to the highest level of customer satisfaction and loyalty, and provide 100% Canadian-based service and support for every product we distribute.
Every day our team comes to work excited to tackle real-world challenges, conceive new ideas and develop groundbreaking, innovative solutions — to make a difference for our customers, our business partners, our colleagues and our company.
We’re proud of the difference we make for our customers and our business partners, and in the communities where we live and work.

Title: Marketing Vice-President - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Salary: $64.50/Hourly
Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Start Date: As soon as possible
Language: English
Minimum Education: Bachelor's Degree
Positions Available: 1
NOC Group: Senior Managers - Financial, Communications and Other Business Services (0013)
NOC Job Title: Marketing Vice-President - Financial, Communications And Other Business Services
Expires in 52 days
Expires: 2022-01-15
Posted: 2021-09-17
Last Updated: 2021-09-17
Job Location(s)
2615-4500 Kingsway
Burnaby, British Columbia
V5H 2A9, Canada
Job Description
Job brief
We are looking for an experienced Vice President (VP) of Marketing to direct and oversee our Marketing department. You will design, implement and monitor effective marketing strategies that align with our business goals.
Our ideal candidate has a solid Marketing background and work experience managing a variety of promotional projects end-to-end, including paid advertising campaigns and digital marketing techniques. Our VP of Marketing will report directly to the President and will oversee internal Marketing teams. To be successful in this role, you should be highly professional. You should also play a significant role shaping the company’s strategic planning.
Ultimately, you should be able to ensure that the Marketing department’s activities contribute to our company’s long-term success.
Responsibilities
Evolve FYD Consultants brand strategy and our services, website and company positioning
Set current and long-term goals for internal teams
Design and manage the Marketing department’s budget
Develop and implement a multi-channel marketing strategy maintaining alignment with target client needs and competitors
Monitor industry trends and customer feedback, and initiate research and analysis to achieve a high level of market expertise and to identify opportunities for growth
Direct the company marketing function to identify and develop new customers
Lead & facilitate the effective & efﬁcient management of all activities & resources within the scope of the business
Develop marketing action plans that clearly define objectives, goals, schedules and achieve targeted opportunities
Increase visibility and presence among key target client
Prepare regular reports and presentations on marketing metrics for the President
Forecast hiring needs for the Marketing and Sales department
Participate in the quarterly and annual planning of the company’s objectives
Track competitors’ activities
Requirements
A university degree above in business administration is required
At least 5 years of experience as a middle manager is required
Demonstrable experience designing and implementing successful marketing campaigns
Solid knowledge of SEO, web analytics and Google Adwords
Experience with digital marketing tools and techniques
Strong leadership skills
Excellent communications skills in written and verbal.
Strong analytical and project management skills
Strategic mindset, and problem –solving skills
How to Apply
Expiring: Jan 15, 2022
Email: mail@fydim.ca

Title: Digital Marketing Sales Consultant - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE:
GCI) is a subscription-led and digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to empowering communities to thrive. With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of millions with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services.
Our current portfolio of media assets includes USA TODAY, local media organizations in 46 states in the U.S., and Newsquest, a wholly owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom with more than 120 local news media brands. Gannett also owns the digital marketing services companies ReachLocal, Inc., UpCurve, Inc., and WordStream, Inc., which are marketed under the LOCALiQ brand, and runs the largest media-owned events business in the U.S., USA TODAY NETWORK Ventures.
To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com.
At REACHLOCAL, A Gannett, Inc. company and part of the USA Today network, we offer a total digital marketing system for local businesses, comprised of web presence solutions digital advertising solutions. Our mission is to help local businesses around the world get more customers. We believe in working hard to deliver results for our clients – and having fun while we build meaningful relationships with everyone around us. That is why we are one of the first digital marketing companies to achieve the Local Search Association (LSA) Certification and have been named a Facebook Marketing Partner, a select group of companies recognized for their ability to drive exceptional advertising and marketing results from Facebook.
We’re looking to build our teams with B2B hunters for our DIGITAL MARKETING SALES CONSULTANT role in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Bring your talent and we'll equip you with exceptional sales tools, technology and world class products. With our 6-week training program and 90-day onboarding plan you will have the tools and skills to succeed in your new role
A bit about us…
REACHLOCAL is a refreshingly agile, vibrant, and fast-paced100% digital marketing company focused on small and medium sized business. We attract and bring together like-minded talented, passionate, and ambitious people who like to collaborate, have fun, and learn together. We keep it 'real' and will encourage you to think 'outside the box' and do what's right for our customers.
Helping local businesses grow through online marketing is our mission, and our people know they're here for a good cause, bringing this to life every day by providing exceptional solutions and services to partner with SMBs. Our client first approach coupled with a genuine desire to understand our clients' needs, expectations, and goals is the driving force behind who we are, what we do, how and why we do it.
As a Digital Marketing Sales Consultant, you’ll have an opportunity to sell a broad set of solutions from our extensive market-leading portfolio such as SEM, SEO, Social Media, YouTube, OTT/CTV, Targeted Display, Websites, Live chat and much more.
What we're looking for...
A sales professional who builds trust and likes to share in your clients' success
Experienced B2B hunter with digital/advertising sales experience
Well-crafted sales process/methodology
Outstanding communication, influencing, and negotiation skills
No fear approach to new business development through cold-calling and networking
Proven ability to build rapport and develop strong business relationships
CRM experience (e.g. Salesforce.com or similar)
Ethical with a high level of personal integrity and initiative
Digital marketing knowledge and experience (e.g. SEM, SEO, Display, Social etc.)
What's in it for you…
Competitive salary coupled with uncapped residual commissions and quarterly bonuses
Fast paced industry that keeps it exciting
Award winning products and service that give you confidence you can deliver for our clients
A great work environment that allows you to build your own schedule
Full benefit package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K & more
Unlimited Vacation Days subject to performance
Monthly business expenses
What you will bring…
B2B solution sales, new business development and cold-calling experience
A well-crafted sales process/methodology
Outstanding communication, influencing, and negotiation skills
No fear approach to new business development through cold-calling and networking
Proven ability to build rapport and develop strong business relationships
CRM experience (e.g. Salesforce.com or similar)
Ethical with a high level of personal integrity and initiative
Digital marketing knowledge and experience (e.g. SEM, SEO, Display, Social etc.)
You can find out more about our awesome products at https://www.reachlocal.com/us/en/digital-marketing-services.
If you think you tick all the boxes, have the right attitude, able to work autonomously, manage your own day and be part of a winning team – this is the opportunity you've been waiting for! Send us your application today so you too can be part of our success story.
About REACHLOCAL, Inc. REACHLOCAL is headquartered in Woodland Hills, CA, with over 35 locations throughout the United States, Canada, India, Australia, New Zealand and Brazil. ReachLocal is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Photographer + Digital Content Producer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Since our inception in 2010, OAK+FORT has curated collections that reflect our design philosophies. OAK + FORT is a belief that fashion should be uncomplicated and thoughtfully designed. We are not distracted or fettered by trends. We will continue to provide attainable luxury to like-minded individuals.
POSITION SUMMARY
As our Photographer + Digital Content Producer, you will be responsible for the production of photography, videography and other digital assets for the Company. This is a unique opportunity for an individual who is passionate for inspiring others through photos and videos, a passion for digital content creation and understands the needs of our audiences. This position reports to the Creative team.
PHOTOGRAPHY
Apply photography techniques to capture images to be included in various digital media platforms, including but not limited to the company website, social media uploads, seasonal campaigns and e-newsletters.
Collaborate with all departments leveraging photography and digital assets to deliver consistent, high quality and on brand product photography;
Bring the Creative Department’s visions to life in partnership with Marketing, and Ecommerce teams;
Ensure content is consistent with seasonal direction, on-brand and compelling
Select and present imagery for review with Creative Directors for approval including but not limited to the Company website, social media uploads, seasonal campaigns and e-newsletters for all lines of business;
Execute processes efficiently ensuring all deadlines and deliverables are met in a timely manner while adhering to budgets;
Assist in location scouting, in-house studio operations including lighting, and equipment, plan and organize photo-shoots;
Plan and collaborate with the Stylist and Creative Content Producer to create on brand content across all platforms.
Assist the Product Catalogue creative direction process;
Manage the testing of seasonal direction for Product Catalogue;
Retouch and edit raw images + video from in-house photoshoots
Update, maintain and track in-house photo equipment;
Perform other projects as assigned.
VIDEOGRAPHY
Focus efforts on the creation of Reels for Instagram + Tik Tok specifically. Drive lifestyle brand content that increases engagement and inspires our audience.
Weekly on set shooting and owning of post-production process.
DIGITAL CONTENT PRODUCTION
Stay informed of current and changing trends in fashion & social media; incorporate emerging trends in delivering images and video for social media platforms.
Invent and explore ways to leverage the newest social media features to deliver on our objectives.
Recommend and identify new ways to create within social media platforms that are at the forefront.
Participate in the development of social media content planning for every channel with strategies to increase brand awareness, audience and customer engagement. Instagram Reels, Shop Shops, and more.
Manage content creation from brief through to final delivery. Plan, organize and execute photo-shoots for new and innovative digital social media platforms in collaboration with the Creative Team. Organize shoots in a regular cadence, on the Creative + Marketing Team schedules.
Collaborate with Art Direction Managers on the creative direction prior to each shoot.
Work with external collaborators on a case-by-case basis. Responsible for providing brand training and the concept brief to all co-creators.
Build brand loyalty, retain the exiting audience base, and acquire new ones.
Operations/Other:
Communicate garment requirements to Stylist to prepare before each photo-shoot.
Work in partnership with the Marketing Team to coordinate timelines and objectives.
REQUIREMENTS
5+ years of photography experience
Knowledge of digital cameras, lighting, and photo composition
Experience with product shooting and working with models
Strong communication skills
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop, Premier and
Lightroom is an asset
Experience working in the fashion retail industry
Ability to travel, work with flexible hours due to nature of the business
Ability to work with a cross-functional team and collaborate
Ability to multi-task and remain composed in a fast-paced environment

Title: Manager, Marketing Communications Cards Franchising - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
The Manager, Marketing Communications Cards Franchising is a key member of the enterprise Marketing team responsible for the planning and implementation of all marketing communications initiatives tied to the franchising of all credit card clients.
As a member of the Marketing Communications team and reporting into the Director, Cards Engagement & Retention you will provide support to the Director in the planning and implementation of direct marketing communications (may include: email, banners, website, mobile/online banking messages, digital media, SMS) for the Cards Engagement & Retention Line of Business, increasing engagement across the consumer lifecycle from onboarding through to retention.
This role will have a specific focus on (but not limited to) Client Engagement Communications across the entire cards portfolio to franchise these clients with CIBC. This role will support the Director and Senior Manager as the key Marketing point of contact and overall relationship manager for the Franchising engagement part of the business. This individual will also be responsible for the overall budget and project management for relevant initiatives within his/her specific area of accountability. The ability for this individual to work within a fast pace environment while providing and advocating for the client experience will excel in this role.
How You’ll Succeed
Project Management
- You will act as a key point of contact for the assigned initiatives and see projects from planning to QA and execution. You will support the creative process in a large, multi-level matrix organization with several layers for approvals.
Creative Development and Measurement
- You will contribute to the planning and implementation, including the creative development of marketing communications initiatives and projects. You will also collaborate with your team, business partners and channel partners to build successful marketing campaigns to generate desired business results and impact.
Communication and Relationship Management
- You will build and develop relationships with key business contacts, channel partners and agencies to become true partner to the business.
Passion
- you will prove your marketing focus and passion by demonstrating strategic ideas that will enable CIBC’s products to stand out in today’s competitive landscape.
Who You Are
You're digitally savvy.
You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You put our clients first.
You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
You understand that success is in the details.
You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
Your influence makes an impact.
You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
You engage with your heart and mind.
You care about people and understand different perspectives. You listen and learn from the experiences of others.
You can demonstrate experience in
digital (email, banner ads, digital media etc) creative development and measurement to drive credit card engagement, and project management at an agency or in financial services. You have strong written communications and analytical skills. You have strong collaboration and relationship management skills.
It’s an asset
if you have copy writing experience.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive
: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect
: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop
: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper
: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-81 Bay, 33rd Floor

Regular
